result.execSummary:
The defendant Toni P. Cayton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Toni P. Cayton

records.addlTxt: Toni Cayton called the COC office informs us that his is unable to pay his payment plan this month and will make a payment in December. Approved by Clerk.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: RCSD Dispo of Warrant or Commitment

Cases 16CM163,17CM14,17CM15 all called together. Defendant Toni P. Cayton in court, in custody, without counsel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Def wishes to proceed with plea/sentencing, pro se. Court will accept def's refusal of counsel. Def pleads NC to all charges. On 17CM14 Atty Harper asks to amend the complaint. Def does not object. Complaint amended by court. Court finds factual basis for all charges. Court's colloquy on plea. Court accepts def's NC pleas to all charges and finds him guilty of all charges. State recommends: 16CM163 9 months jail plus costs,17CM14 90d in jail plus costs, concurrent. 17CM15 90d in jail plus costs, concurrent. With all concurrency, 9 months total in jail time. 29 days credit. Huber possibly allowed. Court takes short recess. 

Court resumes at 03:37pm. Def calls Witness MM. MM sworn and testified.  Comments by def.

Sentence:

16CM163 - 60 days jail.
17CM14 -   60 days jail, consecutive to 16CM163.
17CM15 -   60 days jail for each charge, concurrent with each other but consecutive to 17CM14 and 16CM163.  
Court's intent is for a 6-month jail sentence.

29 days credit.  Huber granted.

Costs waived in all 3 cases.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 3, 2017 at 02:45 pm.

Cases 16CM163, 17CM14, and 17CM15 called together. Defendant Toni P. Cayton appeared by video from the RC Jail without counsel. Prosecuting Atty Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.No offer from DA. Def wants to plea to charges. Forms will be sent to jail by clerk for def.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2017 at 02:45 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on January 17, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

17CM14/initial, 17CM15/initial, and 16CM163/adjourned initial.  Defendant Toni P. Cayton in court, in custody, without counsel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Def wants offer of the DA.  DA says no offer - plea or go to trial.  Def just received the complaints filed today.  1/17 at 1:30 for adjourned initials.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 17, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on January 11, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Toni P. Cayton in court without counsel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. State has provided def with the complaint. Def waives formal reading. Court states the charge and informs def of the possible max. penalties, noting the repeater allegation; asks def if he wants counsel. Def says he doesn't want counsel; just wants to resolve this matter. 

DA asks Court to lift stay of jail in case for which def has already been sentenced. Court states it will not consider that motion at this time.  State withdraws its request. 

Court adj. this case to 1/11 at 11.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 11, 2017 at 11:00 am.
